website_summaries.verdict: A compact and thin hard drive that operates smoothly with different operating systems.
pros: Fast operation if you’re using USB 3.0 connection
Easy to set up and use
Works well with Mac, Windows, Linux, and Ubuntu
cons: Doesn’t automatically back up files – backups are drag and drop only

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for PS4
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to expand the memory on my PS4 and its great. World of advice, it may say it’s not compatible the first time you try to format it, just leave it plugged and reboot the console
customer_reviews.author: SB100

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly and stores all my games nicely. Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this purely for my Xbox One. It works perfectly and stores all my games nicely. Great Value.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Better to seek alternatives than purchase this thing. Pure junk.
customer_reviews.text: And here we go again, for the 2nd time, this drive failed after 6 months of use. All of a sudden, drive fails to be recognized and reports the data is corrupted. How? Since nothing has been written to it in months, its been powered off more than its been powered on. I lost 800+ gig of data, again. I suspect this product is either a knock off or a "refurbished" neither of which are indicated in the advertisement. I shall not purchase again. Going with a SSD from another manufacturer, I give up on toshiba.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive worked perfectly for the first 6 months. After that, it was touch and go. Sometimes it would be recognized, sometimes it wouldn't. Then 3 months ago, it stopped being recognized at all. Lost pictures of friends no longer living, my wedding, my nephews, all my music and games, and a lot of important documents. Reading the other reviews, I am by no means the only one with this problem. Save yourself the trouble. Don't buy a Toshiba external hard drive. It's not worth the risk of losing what's important to you.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Great hardrive, but beware...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hard drive for my daughter for university in 2015. Worked well for 2years then suddenly stopped working in 2018. The hard drive was not connecting to any device. Upon scrolling through user reviews here we realized that maybe the cable was the issue....and it was! The hard drive works great but my advice would be to buy an extra cable just in case you encounter this issue: problem. Could not give it 5 stars for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: TSD

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. It worked great for 6 months and then my computer stopped recognizing it. I tried a new cord and that didn't work. I took it to a data recovery place and they quoted me $1900 to recover everything stored on it. They said the part that failed has to be replaced in a clean room and is very sensitive. I contacted Toshiba and the most they will do if it is under warranty is refund the cost. This is a terrible product and you will most likely lose everything you put on it unless you can afford $1900 to recover the data. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: FIVE STARS RIGHT NOW...WITH A CAVEAT
customer_reviews.text: This 1TB portable HD was purchased for full image backups of a desktop PC. So far it's working great but portable HD's are always somewhat of a crap shoot, with no brand standing out as better (more reliable) over time because all have periodically had issues. I have decades of experience with Western Digital and Seagate drives but decided to go with Toshiba on this purchase. If any problem arises I'll update the review. (BTW, if replacing a PC's internal HD, my present choice would be Western Digital Black.)
customer_reviews.author: ENGINEER 10388

customer_reviews.title: This product became faulty after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: This product became faulty after a few months. My wife and I decided to back up our pictures and important documents to this external hard drive a few months back. Unfortunately, our computer decided to crash and we were happy that we got this backup for our new computer. Once we plugged in the hard drive it starts clicking and doesn't load up. Apparently other customers have experienced the same issues. My wife was horrified knowing that most of our wedding pictures and videos were lost. Hopefully we can salvage some of the photos by having someone see if they can extract the files. We will never buy another Toshiba product again. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT LAST A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: Had this hard drive for less than a year (bought december 2017) and had less than 500gb of data stored on it and it crapped out on me while trying to save a Word doc. Almost lost all my of work, school, and personal files. Luckily my computer could still read it so i could transfer the files over. The hard drive was never dropped, spilled on, etc. and it was always ejected properly. Definitely not worth the headache.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected. A+
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget to use Disk Management to assign a drive letter. I used drive letter Z. Then format drive using "new simple volume". Otherwise, Windows 10 will not recognize drive.The Canvio is not an SSD. However, it's very fast, quiet, and works great. Absolute excellent buy and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Canvio Basic Did not Last
customer_reviews.text: Great price, worked well for 15 months but then just quit. I have used this for a backup disk no my iMac it just quit yesterday. I would expect a Toshiba to last longer than 15 months, but I guess not. Luckily I have two backup for my important files, My other backup and my external that holds files are all Western Digital, all are still working. The replacement I just ordered is also a WD. I would not recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Maury Swoveland

customer_reviews.title: Tons of Space for my videos and travel content
customer_reviews.text: As a blogger, making content is what I do. But you need SPACE. As a traveling blogger, I am taking photos, making videos, recording audio podcasts - you get the idea. This is a great little investment for a lot of space and not needing to plug in (which is hard when you’re on a high speed train in China for example). I can credit this little hard drive with helping backup some of Mike’s blog when my camera was overloaded with content and I didn’t have time to go to my home office. Hey, I should get another just because! Only issue is sometimes my Mac desn't recognize it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Michelini

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Shut Off When Ejecting
customer_reviews.text: When attempting to remove / eject the device from the computer, it does not allow you to "shut it down" for safe removal. The blue light continues to stay on with a prompt on the computer that states "removal may cause data to be lost". Although no files have been lost yet, there is always an uneasy feeling. Otherwise, it seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I received this item approximately 3yrs ago, up to this point I have not had any issues. I went to plug it into my computer last week and it would not recognize the drive, it starts clicking and the light flashes but nothing will load. This never leaves my desk, it never gets tossed around, it simply just quit working. I took it in to a data recovery service and they quoted me $850 to recover 80% of the data. Extremely disappointed in the performance of this item. Toshiba possibly has the worst customer service I have ever encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works for PS4
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good condition and worked perfectly with my PS4 as an extended storage.
customer_reviews.author: YJ

customer_reviews.title: Will die on you fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for an easy way to transfer files back and forth from school so that I didn't have to carry my computer with me (computers available for free check out at my school). This product was fine for a while, but I was always nervous about the cheap connector cable, as it would easily fall out of the connection port if I bumped it at all. I tried to be very careful with it at all times. Out of the blue, it stopped working barely 1 1/2 years after I purchased it. For a $50+ dollar product that I take care of and only sometimes use, I expected much higher quality and a much longer life.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Exactly what I needed to expand my Xbox One memory!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I needed to expand my Xbox One memory. Fast shipping. Hooked it up to my Xbox One. No issues, it immediately registered that there was an external drive hooked up to it. So now I have an extra TB of hard drive memory to store my games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this extended storage on my PS4 for my saved files and download games. I have no complaints about it. I plugged it in through the USB port and was ready to go. It's smaller than most phones, at least smaller than mine; and light weight, no much heavier than my Moto Z. I have not used it on my computer, the PS4 has a problem with sharing and will erase any saved data when it reformats. It seems pretty durable, it has traveled well with my PS4, so I do believe there would be a risk of damaging it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Seemed okay for awhile then began having issues. Reaching out to tech support never brought any answers or fixes and now, in less than 2 years, its dead for good. Not a good time frame for a device thats not used a ton. I have cheaper brands that are still going for over twice that time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Diagnostic reported problem, but still going
customer_reviews.text: Crystal Disk Info reported a problem after a few weeks. Relocated sectors, I recall. My understanding is that that's one of those things that is to be understood as: your drive could fail suddenly anytime. I use it as a music backup (and sometimes play from it), and I have other backups, so not so big a deal. It's still going after 3 years of moderate use. The cord is USB into computer, but some kind of dedicated plug on other end. That seems stupid, and prevents me from using a longer cord. However, maybe that is the idea: perhaps a longer cord would lower the voltage too much and damage it.
customer_reviews.author: P Leabow

customer_reviews.title: Reliable drive but the technology is outdated...slooowwww.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these Toshiba a drives for backups. They’re mostly good for backing up files rather than everyday use. The drive technology is a bit outdated and is slow. Although the drives have been completely reliable, it’s too slow to transfer my large 3D files. Save up, and buy a solid state drive (SSD) instead. Anyway, some of the new SSD external drives are water resistant and shock proof, this Toshiba is not.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Best HD for your money!
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive has to be the very best one on the market. I made my most recent purchase to relieve a previous model of this HD that I have used for 2 years. I plan to continue to use the older model as my back up. This HD is reliable, durable and is pulled in and out of my bag multiple times every day. It's basically a work horse. It always starts promptly, works quietly and has never lost a MB of data. I highly recommend this HD if you need one for on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Arnold

customer_reviews.title: 1TB
customer_reviews.text: I CUT THE CABLE AND USE THIS TO STORE MY RECORDED SHOWS. SO FAR SO GOOD. I USE IT WITH THE CHANNEL MASTER STREAM , ALSO SOLD ON AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: PJ444

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Cheaply made, very slow drive. Feels cheap. Copies files EXTREMELY slow for a USB3 drive. Seriously. SLOW!
customer_reviews.author: Home Studio Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love itttt! I got this because i had an old laptop that had some info i didn't want to lose but i wanted to get rid of that outdated slow laptop brick. So, it was super easy to use, plug and play installation that only took about a minute. The only thing that i would change if i could is i wish it had a clear case where i could attach it to the top of my laptop. The hard drive does not seem to get hot at all. Even after hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Steed

customer_reviews.title: Works for Xbox 360
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 terabyte version to expand my xbox storage space. It works great. I've installed and downloaded games on the new drive and everything works. I've seen no problems or slow downs when playing off the drive either. The only thing I've noticed is that when downloading a game directly onto the drive it takes longer than usually. This is why I like to download games directly to the xbox drive and than simply transfer over the game to the toshiba drive before launching.
customer_reviews.author: Dan.M

customer_reviews.title: Fairly fast and packed well
customer_reviews.text: Got maximum transfer speed of 130 MB/s (that's MB, not Mb). Came packed very safely, yet was still easily unpacked. It came in a sort of "bubble-sleeve" (it reminds me of those inflatable pool floats), that you can slide the drive out of. I'm keeping it for safe storage whenever I'm not using the drive. LED on the front of the drive indicates whether you've plugged the drive into a USB 2.0 (white) or USB 3.0 (blue) port, which is an interesting feature.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser Black

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.  Very low price.  No power-brick needed.  Very portable.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 of these, so you know we like them. Very small, handy size. After formatting, the 1TB is really 931GB. (As expected.) No power-brick needed. Yeah! (As long as your USB ports can put out enough power to power the unit.) Only ties up 1 USB port (not 2). Speed is average for a USB3.0 device. One became our backup device. Another became our DVR storage. And the 3rd is used as a spare. VERY inexpensive for a 1TB USB3 device.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Updated 01-26-20
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in November 2015. Thus far it is working great. It has the nice rounded. My previous Seagate only had 500 GB & lasted 16-months & I didn't use it all the time. I still have a 1 TB but opted to not to return to Seagate for certain reasons. However, the 1 TB works great as I can hold a substantial amount of data. My reasoning for 2 drives is an extra back up. This unit runs faster & doesn't bog down when transferring data. Lasted 2-years & lost a lot of files I was working with. Sucks as I have a 1TB Seagate from 2014. Guess I'm going back to Seagate!! Goodbye Toshiba.
customer_reviews.author: RKG

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I need it for (even though it can handle much more than that)
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backup hard drive for all of the pictures and videos of my son that I would be devastated if anything happened to them (because having them on my phone and two laptops isn't enough!). With this hard drive, I can feel confident that I have enough room for the first five years of his life, at least. This is a heavy-duty hard drive, though, so I know it can handle much more than what I'm using it for, but for what I need it for it's perfect just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Casey May

customer_reviews.title: Works great.. But 3 years later..???
customer_reviews.text: I know this review is late but here's what I experienced. This is a great product saved all my Xbox games, good storage and definitely worth every penny. I bought this external hard drive 3 years ago and fast forward til now.... It's dead. I take really care of my electronics, but 3 days ago I played my Xbox with no problem. All my games loaded up and everything, til today. The blue light doesn't blink or a white light like some have suggested they have seen. Like I said great product til now 3 years later and poof!!! Dead...
customer_reviews.author: DDee

customer_reviews.title: Used for DLNA playback and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome for media storage and playback and is shareable directly over a network with the right connections. If you plan to this for heavy DLNA playback, make sure you got a router that won't die from exhaustion. I used this bad boyand it actually came with this hard drive all for $299. Much better performance than any other router I've seen or tested on the market. Remember: NO hard-drive is immortal, make sure you backup your important data no matter how fool proof you think a drive is.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Frost

customer_reviews.title: Great external drive, no problems so far after over 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device for over 2 years and it is still working flawlessly. I store all of my important data on here and use it as external storage for my phone. I also store movies and other large files on here so they do not take up space on my devices. You can run the movies while the drive is plugged in to your computer, tablet, or other device.
customer_reviews.author: abigail

customer_reviews.title: Not even a year in and it's stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: It was working fine up until a few days ago. I'm not even a year into use, and it's no longer connecting. It's ejecting itself, likely corrupting the ~year of backups I have on it. Cool. I haven't been rough on it, it's always been at home, and yet the cord seems to be faulty. Now I have to buy a new cord myself. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - so far.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Great product. Let's see if these external discs last more than a month... A plus: doesn't need any software, doesn't need any power line, just plug it. Fast, easy to use. No problem so far. Not like one of my WD Books that my computer can recognize only after hundreds of attempts. And Amazon charges the lowest price as far as I know!
customer_reviews.author: Sylgal

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Canvio 1 TB Portable Hard Drive Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Toshiba Canvio 1TB Portable Hard Drive to back up my laptop and store pictures from my iPhone. This works great and is fast with the USB 3.0 connection. Installation was quick and easy with its plug and play operation. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a 1 TB external hard drive!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Update: 1 year and 5 months of use, still works perfectly. I do photoshop and illustrator work with files saved on this device, no complains. The only time I had issues with it was when plugging it on a usb port hub (I think it was the hub's fault) but other than that, I've been very happy with this hard drive! I'm planning to buy another one. ===== Previous review: So far so good!. I've been using it for about 2.5 months to save my videos and graphic design files. It's been plugged in my computer since I got it and has worked fine!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: This hard drive is super small and the space is incredible
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is super small and the space is incredible. I got this as a present to my boyfriend, he is an artist. he needs a loooot of space for his file. the last hard drive broke in a trip, so I was looking for the best options. as you can see on the pictures the size of the hard drive fit on my hand, and I have petite hands haha. the guarantee comes as a file in the hard drive and the protection too. it a very good deal for the size and space that it has. I would definitely recommended
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: works great but for how long?
customer_reviews.text: Thing worked great for about 90 days then started clicking loudly and disconnecting itself. Not very reliable over time. I never unplugged it, traveled with it, nor damaged it, it remained in the same spot for as long as I've owned it. May go for a solid state external drive for future external storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space!! Love this hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to store the large amounts of picture I have on my computer. My computer storage was getting full and I did not want something to happen to the computer where I lose all my memories so I bought this to store it on. This hold a ton of pictures and videos. I have so much space available still that I just keep adding my pictures as I get them. This is easy enough to use as well and self explanatory which is great! The loading goes pretty decently fast too. I store this in my fireproof safe too, just in case, I don't want to lose my information and memories. This thing is a life saver!!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t last as long as I was hoping... Will randomly cut out and shut off, which messes with the files stored on it. It worked well while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Blake B

customer_reviews.title: Very slow.
customer_reviews.text: Very, very slow backup. Took over a day to back up ~85 GB of data. It's looking like it will take 2-3 days to encrypt the drive! This is all on Mac. I saw another Mac user post about slow backup as well, so it's not just me. The HGST Touro S HD is much better but unfortunately it is no longer sold.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Still great 4 years later!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the “Classic” model four years ago (HDTB310XK3AA), and despite all it’s been through, this portable hard drive continues to serve me well! Now, to be perfectly honest, I don't use this drive daily. In fact, DriveDx clocks it's total usage at 6,075 hours, which is equivalent to only about 8.5 months (though I really question the accuracy of that...). Regardless, here's hoping it will beat the record set by another Toshiba drive I had, which I recently retired after nearly 7 years!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after four months of backup drive use
customer_reviews.text: I used this disk for my Mac Time Machine backup. It failed after four months, to the point that Disk Utility could not recover the data due to hardware problems. This isn't good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: If I had known that it would have been this easy
customer_reviews.text: It is so wonderful to have a child in the house that does not get flustered with technology. I admit I am from that generation that thinks no good can come from simple technology, but I have to say that this little device is amazing. Easily transferred photos. Plenty of room for copies of important documents. Takes up no space at all. Makes me wonder why we did not do this sooner. I did go back and forth prior to purchase with a couple of other similar items, but for the price and size, this Toshiba had all that I needed with more space to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Best external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. It looks so nice and professional. I love the little blue light that turns on, too. It works well and transfers fast. I filled up 1TB and it's all good. A little unfortunate it only comes with a USB Type-A cable though. You'll need to purchase an additional USB-C to Micro-B for Macs.
customer_reviews.author: A.I.

customer_reviews.title: We had an external hard drive that was externally powered ...
customer_reviews.text: We had an external hard drive that was externally powered. The power port broke - and based on reviews it was a common issue. I decided to go with this hard drive based on others reviews. I wasn't sure if it would work on a roku (plugged into the usb port), but it does! We moved our kids movies onto this hard drive and its regularly hooked up to the roku. The bonus is that there is so much space that we can back up our laptops onto this hard drive without worry that we will lose anything important.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This lazy Untruthful Vendor
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased the Toshiba Canvio Basics 1TB (CLASSIC) Portable Hard Drive, but knowing they had non in stock they sent me out the cheaper version (CONTEMPORARY) after I already paid the differential for the (CLASSIC)! This was just a waste of time and my money, I should've followed my first mind and just went to a brick and mortar electronics store!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Turner-Ford

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this HD
customer_reviews.text: i use this HD almost daily with my playstation 4. all of my games are downloaded on it and its fast enough and ive never had any problems with it. I would definitely recommend this HD
customer_reviews.author: kelso

customer_reviews.title: Laggy
customer_reviews.text: This HD cost $45, compared to $55 for some other brands. But unlike other HDs we've used, this one is apparently set up to initiate its spindown very quickly after using it, i.e. put the HD in a dormant state. This means that when you work on a file for a few minutes, and go to save your progress, your program will hang for several seconds while the HD spins back into action. This is a nuisance, and the HD provides no feature to control this. We had to find a free 3rd party program called xSleep to do so. So it's up to you to decide whether this makes it worth saving $10.
customer_reviews.author: 4 Leaf Clover

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. I had bought a portab k e hard drive years ago and it is 3 times the size of this one and needs power.... I love the compact design of the Toshiba. I bought a carry case to go with it, which makes me feel better for as much as we use it. It was easy to plug in and go. It reminded me of a flash drive, very easy. My husband and I share it so the small design makes it the perfect "must have" for all our computer needs.
customer_reviews.author: AnndiSmith

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Quality
customer_reviews.text: A truly outstanding 1TB external hard drive for the price! It comes already NTFS formated, plug & play, and without any goofy bloatware apps hardly anyone I know uses. It's extremely quiet, super fast data transfer, and the mat finish doesn't pick up greasy finger smudges. All in all, a true five star winner worth purchasing again. As a side note, if possible, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics case. It's great storage, protection, and a perfect to the 'T' fit for the USB cable and the drive. You can't go wrong with this combination.
customer_reviews.author: BottomLine

customer_reviews.title: Its a shame because i actually have another portable hd from toshiba from 2011 and that baby works fine. I bought this hd when t
customer_reviews.text: I bulk transfered some files from a pre win10 upgrade and i heard the hard drive error clicking a few times. After booting up win10, my drive was corrupted/unreadable but knew it had some fix since i could see amount of GB usage/available when I opened an explorer windows. So i did a scansdisk on that drive to detect error and it turns out I can now read it but the drive (most likely) has errors. Its a shame because i actually have another portable hd from toshiba from 2011 and that baby works fine. I bought this hd when the price lowered a lot. I guess they were selling a defective lot of the product. F ME
customer_reviews.author: GAZ RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Saving pictures
customer_reviews.text: So my family is moving and we didn't want to take our old computers that weigh a ton, but have a lot of family pictures on them. We bought this small, light weight device and were able to preserve all of all family memories in minutes! All you have to do is plug it in through the USB port, and drag your files over to the device. It is so simple and quick! I would recommend this product to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backup to hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cloning your hard disk. I back up my hard disk every 2 to 4 weeks just in case my main drive crashes. So far I have not had need to do this but knowing I have a fairly recent backup of my hard drive cut way down on the worry factor.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great portable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: The device has functioned flawlessly and is a good portable size. Any gripes are more on me. I used this for my son's new Xbox One S. Unfortunately, I realized too late that the games require far more memory than I expected; however, 1 TB is still a good start. It seems that many newer games range from 40-90+GB per. If I had to do it over again, I would have gone the next size up. Good luck, this one is a good buy for 1 TB.
customer_reviews.author: JayRT

customer_reviews.title: Seems to good to be true.
customer_reviews.text: (Update) purchased in June 2016. Its May 2019. This little beast is my work laptop backup HD. It eats it up and I’m barely making a dent in available space. Such a great value! Super fast delivery. Solid construction and great price. Extremely easy to setup and use. I like to backup my files from my laptop to usb memory stick once a month. It was starting to take too long and too much data for any of my sticks. Sooooo. Purchased this hd. Don't have to worry about overflowing a terrabit anytime soon and the copy process was much faster. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun A. Whitehorse

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Lil' Brick
customer_reviews.text: A purchase made in a panic because my MacBook Pro crashed with all my files, and I wanted to make sure that never happens again. Two years later and I'm still making Time Machine updates to it perfectly fine. It takes a while to back up, but it helps if I quit everything on my Mac and run no programs in the background while it backs-up.
customer_reviews.author: Desva

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Easy-to-install Storage.
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate longevity yet but I have a Toshiba 2 TB that has been online for over a year with no issues. Simple to connect and map to a Windows 7 box. Just plug it in and name it. I use it for backup and mapped it to B: since nothing uses that designation. Windows warned that it may cause an issue with some software but it has been fine - there's never going to be a floppy drive to cause a conflict.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Died after only 8 months - lost over 35,700 family pictures and movies
customer_reviews.text: ZERO STARS - Died after only 8 months - lost over 35,700 family pictures and movies. SO HEARTBREAKING! And Toshiba said they won't help pay for the $1500 it costs to retrieve them. Don't buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Berry

customer_reviews.title: never fails and seems to be perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: never fails and seems to be perfect for my needs. I record over the air antenna shows with this drive. I have it about half full, didn't think that I would use it as much as I do. Almost wish I had purchased the 2T but could not dream that I would ever be able to use all of that. Watch TV shows when I want to see them not necessarily when they were broadcast. Nice to be the boss.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Needed to back-up files for an old PC. Rather than burn 15 DVD's, got this instead. Everything fits on this drive with plenty of room to spare. Only took 30 minutes to download. Fast shipping too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: blade

customer_reviews.title: Useful external drive for storing a lot of media.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this hard drive for several months now to store files on a laptop I use remotely as a server. The good is it's compact, doesn't require an external power supply and is very easy to move around. The transfer speeds seem decent for what I use it for. It could be faster but you're only paying for a 5400 RPM hard drive here so don't expect a miracle. So far this little guy has been pretty reliable and until portable SSDs come down in price I think this is a great product to use.
customer_reviews.author: patrickane

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit Nov 2015. It has always been dependable. I store many different types of files, photos, videos, documents, data etc. I'm buying another one to be dedicated to storing my artwork. This unit travels between my studio and home computers as needed. Never a glitch, no missing files. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sedonartist

customer_reviews.title: I have so much free space on my computer now!
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive is awesome! I had nearly 200 GB of movies, documents, and pictures on my computer, and nothing happened to any of it (that I know of) during the transfer. The only think i don't like is that the plug isn't in there very tight and if you move it wrong it'll disconnect pretty easily, so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Plug malfunctioned and lost access to files.
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 years and very little use, the usb socket in the side of the unit ceased to function. I was able to transfer a few important folders off by rigging the plug in place with a tangled array of rubber bands before I lost access for good.
customer_reviews.author: lordwillin

customer_reviews.title: Small, quiet, no crapware.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't try and install crapware on your computer when you plug it in -- that's almost worthy of five stars all by itself. It's fast (it should be with USB 3.0) and quiet. It's small enough to slip into the foam sleeve I used to keep my laptop in. It's not supposed to be an exciting product, but it does seem to be well made. The included cable is on the short side but to me that's a plus as it won't add clutter to my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to download and easy to upload them back to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my husband laptop upgraded to Windows 10. It works perfectly. Just connected and it was set up as Drive F:. We downloaded hundreds of huge size pictures. Easy to download and easy to upload them back to the Drive C: Small, compact, nice! I just bought two more for my office and I'll recommend another office to buy some more now that I learned that it can be formatted easily to MAC.
customer_reviews.author: Coha92

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought it again...
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this after I bought one about a year before. Our old Western Digital died on us and this was the replacement (I'm a 2 back up kind of girl). So now I have two of these and they work great as back ups for our files/photos/music/movies. I like how small and portable they are, that they only use USB (no plug), and I've never had issues.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what happened, but I bought this hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened, but I bought this hard drive last august. Everything was working until now (may the following year). The transfer speed dropped to a few mb/second and it often freezes during the transfer process. Also, the hard drive seems to disconnect and reconnect on its own which frustrates me even more when I am trying to transfer files between the computer and the hard drive. I've tried with the cable provided and with another cable that I bought off amazon, and both cables have the same issues. I haven't even used 50 gb worth of space and it has already become unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Fuji

customer_reviews.title: Easy to format & use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to back up my IMac with Time Machine. So far, so good. Previously I had used a 1TB external hard drive , which I paid more money for than I did this little portable drive. After only a few months the other drive suddenly stopped working . Now it's a paperweight. This new drive arrived promptly . It was easy to format for my Mac using the instructions I found in the reviews here on Amazon. It's small and unobtrusive . Unlike the bigger drive that failed , the Toshiba is silent. It's doing what it's supposed to be doing and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie DuFresne

customer_reviews.title: Cool External Hard Drive. Plug It And Play.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my xbox one s. I just plugged it in, named it and was ready to go. Mine holds about 40 big games and a couple dozen apps. I also like that I can just hook it up to the xbox in my room as well without any extra work. I just plug it in and play.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: works great windows 10
customer_reviews.text: works great windows 10 ... also realized the my internal HD in my Lenovo laptop has a Toshiba drive as well, so while I was reluctant at first since I historically stuck to WD or Seagate drives, I was pleased to find out that a Toshiba drive a really good drive. very fast on 3.0USB
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed! Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have always have good experiences with Toshiba hard disk products. This is a very fast hard drive. Image backup of my SSD drive normally took over an hour on either Seagate USB drive or Western Digital USB drive. It took less than 15 minutes with this Toshiba Canvio Basics. This drive uses a USB 3.0. I have seen transfer rate of over 125 MB/s on my 3.0 GHZ 8 GB RAM Dell computer. I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: N Li

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a more expensive HD and it was not a plug and play and huge disappointment so I ordered this one. Have to say I'm extremely happy! I plugged it in and it installed in 30 seconds with no effort. Transfer was surprisingly fast! I had family photos and videos in the thousands and this baby loaded them fast and fit everything - including 1000 songs as well - with room to spare! Backed up 10 years worth of items from my laptop in about 2 hours. With the amount I had that's quick! lol
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hard drive!!! As a DJ, I needed a good device to organize and back up my music files. Toshiba Canvio Basics is perfect for that. It's practical, starts right away, at the click of a mouse, without complicated set-ups, log-ins, etc. I've already organized 20,669 tracks in 635 files and that's only taken up to 76 GB. AND I still have room for my pictures, videos, university documents, etc.All in all, I've only used up 117GB and ithat's pretty much all the files I have produced, downloaded and accumulated so far. I guess my challenge now is to find more files to try and fill that 1TB up in this life!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good plug and play drive, fast, lots of storage and durable.
customer_reviews.text: This Drive is good for a variety of uses. You can store you videos, pictures, and more on here. It's plug and play so you simply plug in and it shows up, much like a thumb drive. A LOT of storage, so you won't need to worry about running out of space. It's also fast enough so you can use it as the storage device for a plex server and you can cast right from it. Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bux

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded driver fix, just clicks, never recognized on computer. Worst decision, should have bought the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Wit's End

customer_reviews.title: OMG perfect! When they say plug and play they mean ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG perfect! When they say plug and play they mean it! So simple to use, and it has a ****ton of space - I copied every single file, document, photo, music, etc. from my old computer to transfer to my new one and there is STILL a ton of room! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Good hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for changing things from one computer to another. Also good for keeping things backed up on. Easily transportable and easy to access. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great for a year...and then completely died w/ old internet dial-up sounds & ALL file are gone.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about a year, but now it's completely dead. Neither a pc or mac can read/find/view this.
customer_reviews.author: Amz.Verified

customer_reviews.title: Fulfills your needs
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a cheap, reliable, and high capacity hard drive. I was looking around for a 1tb hd that was reliable and the only one in my price range was this Toshiba one. Decided to give it a try and it’s exactly what I needed. The only change I would wish they went with was a usb c hd instead of the one they have.
customer_reviews.author: Khush31

customer_reviews.title: EASY!
customer_reviews.text: EASY!!! Finally, a portable HD that doesnt require you to install software. You plug it in and start backing up. My only complaint was that the instructions say: "Needs to be reconfigured for a Mac". That's it! No more info! How ridiculous is that? The good news is if you google it, one of the tops search results is someone who gives very easy instructions as to how to do this reconfiguration. It takes about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: The price was great and 1 tb was plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my little brother for his Xbox One. The price was great and 1 tb was plenty of space. Set up was as simple as plugging it in and going to the settings on the Xbox. He no longer needs to delete older games to install new games. The only downfall (and this is because of Xbox, not the hard drive) is that he can only use it for the Xbox, the xbox won't allow anything else to be on the hard drive. But for the price, I may end up picking up another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JAZ

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Stopped working with my Surface for no reason.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 years. I've used it for a basic backup of my computer and extra storage, no more. It has only been used occassionaly. Now all it does it blink and waste processing power for my computer when it's plugged in. I am able to access some of its files when I have it connected to my projector, but I can't even see the files on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Lachlan Kadick

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: Great build and buy for the price, runs super fast for videos. I use it mainly for photo and video storage. Love it and super small, I stuck some velcro on it and the top of my laptop so it wouldn't take up desk space. Looks tactical great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Great little hard drive. I backed up everything from my computer before reinstalling Windows and I have plenty of space to spare. It has worked flawlessly and I have had no issues at all. Makes a great backup to store pictures, videos, music and personal documents. I no longer feel the need to pay for a cloud service to back everything up because I have this handy little box right here.
customer_reviews.author: William Bannier

customer_reviews.title: and this works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: The arrived in a timely manner, and was packaged with care. The unit itself was very simply plug and use, and works exactly as expected. My personal use for this was as external storage space for my PS4 unit, and this works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jonus

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big techie and purchased this only to make moving the files from my Windows XP computer to a new computer easier. To that end, this worked quickly and flawlessly. In the process, I now also have a backup of all files on the old computer as well as a way to back up files on the new one. I'd never done that before, but in hindsight, with years of family photos and financials stored on the computer's hard drive, I was fortunate that I never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: 1 Man Army

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I use it for extra storage for my Xbox One and it works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Chadillac

customer_reviews.title: An exceptional value that is truly "Plug and Play" !!
customer_reviews.text: This product is truly plug and play. I opened the package, attached the USB cable, the driver installed automatically and I was backing up my entire hard drive - all in under a minute. A wonderful, ultra compact and lightweight product that really WORKS!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zilla

customer_reviews.title: Compact 1TB at a great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very compact 1TB drive at a good value. Very happy with it. It's approximately the size of a men's wallet (actually a bit smaller and thinner but it's a good point of reference). The computer recognizes it with no problems. Actual usable space shows up as 931MB on mine
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, reliable, and great value (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this while it was still $50. It isn't heavy and doesn't seem too fragile (still wouldn't want to drop it). Works great for storing all of my games and I'm able to play them from different computers with ease. It was available to use immediately after being plugged in. As someone else said, 1Tb is actually 931GB, but I assume that's what most other hard-drives have quantified it as.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased as I liked the first one so well and needed another one for another use. Very user friendly!! Just plugged it in and started copying files to it. If I need another I will definitely purchase this same brand and model.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Skies

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for photographers
customer_reviews.text: Got this gift for my wife as she was always complaining of not giving enough storage space for her pictures. This was a great gift as she is able to store all of her pictures in here. It's been 2 years worth of pictures and haven't even made a dent in the memory.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and user friendly. Comes compatible to Windows, but very easy to configure to Mac. My husband and I are not computer savvy AT ALL, and we figured it out by watching a youtube video. It is super easy to use and you just drag and drop the files. Love it, perfect for storing all of our photos.
customer_reviews.author: LRoll_RN

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is still holding on strong. I did buy it recently, but thus far, it is smooth sailing and much better than my old one. This is extremely easy to use and just needs to be plugged into your computer. I have added so much onto it so far for school and for entertainment and I still have so much room yet to go. I would DEFINITELY recommend this to other. The only reason I did not give it a 5/5 stars is because I haven't had it for a long enough time to really know how sturdy it is. Thus far, though, both the hard drive and the connector cord are holding up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous13

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Canvio Basics 1TB Portable Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box with my Channel Master over the air DVR. Plugged it in to usb port on the DVR. DVR recognized and formatted it for recording use.
customer_reviews.author: TJR - Cleveland, OH

customer_reviews.title: ... Basics 1TB external hard drive it gave me more joy when I found out how to transfer very large ...
customer_reviews.text: The Toshiba Canvio Basics 1TB external hard drive it gave me more joy when I found out how to transfer very large files like 10 or 15 gbs HD movies from my computer to the Toshiba USB external hard drive and I can watch on my Ps4 with no problem.. I recommend for those who like to watch HD movies on the big screen. .. it's very useful. And also if your computer is running out of space" you can copy very large files to the hard drive and you can copy back to the computer anytime you need for your work. *****
customer_reviews.author: luis flores

customer_reviews.title: 0 is also super fast. Sometimes it'll shut off without me having ...
customer_reviews.text: Very small, portable, and light. Only uses 1 cable, which is a huge step-up from my previous external HDD. The USB 3.0 is also super fast. Sometimes it'll shut off without me having done anything, but I think that's an issue on my PC end, rather than with the HDD itself.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

product_meta.title: Toshiba Canvio Basics 1TB Portable Hard Drive - Black (HDTB310XK3AA)
feature_bullets: Easy to use with no software to install
Accommodates large digital files with spacious storage capacity
Protects your drive (Internal Shock Sensor and Ramp Loading Technology)
Gives you peace of mind (Toshiba 1-Year Limited Warranty)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,690 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
